author: KATE FELDMAN
title: Lin-Manuel Miranda, Ruth Negga sport ACLU ribbons during Oscars
text:
31 PM 
A subtle hint of blue dominated the Oscars Sunday night in support of the ACLU. 
“Loving” star Ruth Negga, Lin-Manuel Miranda and his mother, Karlie Kloss, "Moonlight" director Barry Jenkins and other celebrities sported bright blue ribbons on the red carpet in support of the civil liberties union. Luz Towns-Miranda, left, and Lin-Manuel Miranda arrive at the Oscars on Sunday, Feb. 26, 2017, at the Dolby Theatre in Los Angeles. (Photo by Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP) (Jordan Strauss/Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP) 
Karlie Kloss, Lin-Manuel Miranda and his mother, Luz Towns-Miranda, were also sported the ribbons on the Oscars red carpet. 
The symbol comes directly from the organization’s “Stand with ACLU” initiative to encourage support “for the rights and civil liberties guaranteed by the Constitution to everyone in the United States.” 
Negga, who paired her blue ribbon with a long-sleeve red Valentino gown, is nominated for Best Supporting Actress for her role as Mildred in “Loving.” 
The historical drama, which also stars Joel Edgerton, follows Richard and Mildred Loving and their 1967 Supreme Court case over interracial marriage, which was eventually taken up by the ACLU. Join the Conversation:
